title: Compiler Option::unwrap() error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I cannot minify this code, so here goes the full code that causes the issue: ### Code https://git.sr.ht/~matthiasbeyer/distrox/commit/61508472c25393170279ceabb2199e795b018ef1 ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`. warning: `distrox` (bin "distrox") generated 9 warnings error: could not compile `distrox` due to 2 previous errors; 9 warnings emitted ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/std/src/panicking.rs:517:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:100:14 2: core::panicking::panic at /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/library/core/src/panicking.rs:50:5 3: ::def_path_hash_to_def_id 4: rustc_middle::dep_graph::dep_node:: for rustc_span::def_id::LocalDefId>::recover 5: rustc_query_impl::query_callbacks::hir_owner::force_from_dep_node 6: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 7: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 8: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_must_run 9: ::check_mod_item_types 10: rustc_middle::hir::map::Map::for_each_module 11: rustc_typeck::check_crate 12: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 13: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task 14: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 15: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query 16: ::analysis 17: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 18: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 19: rustc_span::with_source_map 20: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0433`. warning: `distrox` (bin "distrox") generated 9 warnings error: could not compile `distrox` due to 2 previous errors; 9 warnings emitted ```
